message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper proposes a method for generating high-quality videos from a single image using convolutional neural networks. The focus is on landscapes, specifically skies and waters. The method involves learning motion and appearance separately and predicting them with decoupled control while handling future uncertainty in both predictions by introducing latent codes. The paper also mentions self-supervised learning and comparisons with state-of-the-art methods in video prediction and appearance manipulation. Based on these details, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is computer vision (cs.CV), followed by graphics (cs.GR), multimedia (cs.MM), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and machine learning (cs.LG).
